DataElement.preferredName: Microarray Data Quantitation Type Search Criterion File Category FileCategory
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:A method for calculating a single datum of the matrix (e.g. raw intensity, background, error).:The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._A set of related records (either written or electronic) kept together.:This term is used informally to mean a class of things._The category that a file belongs to.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Microarray Data Quantitation Type Search Criterion
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:A method for calculating a single datum of the matrix (e.g. raw intensity, background, error).:The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

Concepts.definition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
A method for calculating a single datum of the matrix (e.g. raw intensity, background, error).
The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

Property.preferredDefinition: A set of related records (either written or electronic) kept together.:This term is used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A set of related records (either written or electronic) kept together.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:The act of working out the form of something (as by making a sketch or outline or plan) or the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.
The act of working out the form of something (as by making a sketch or outline or plan) or the result of this activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tab-delimited, spreadsheet-based format that can be used for annotating and communicating microarray data in a MIAME (Minimum Information About a Microarray Experiment) compliant fashion.

Concepts.definition: A tab-delimited, spreadsheet-based format that can be used for annotating and communicating microarray data with experimental details in a MIAME (Minimum Information About a Microarray Experiment) compliant fashion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
